content.1: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh
content.2: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
content.4: The words of a man’s mouth
content.6: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.
content.9: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
content.12: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour
content.13: He that answereth a matter before he heareth
content.14: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
content.15: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
content.16: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
content.18: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
content.20: A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth;
content.23: The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.
